item.title: Making Statistics Visible
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.

item.title: Curry
item.description: Curry <- read.csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/centerandspread/centerandspread.github.io/master/data/Curry.csv") A list of general descriptives. summary(Curry) ## PLAYER GAME_DATE W_L MIN PTS ## Stephen Curry:79 1/10/17: 1 L:14 Min. :27.00 Min. : 8.0 ## 1/12/17: 1 W:65 1st Qu.:30.00 1st Qu.:20.5 ## 1/16/17: 1 Median :34.00 Median :25.0 ## 1/18/17: 1 Mean :33.37 Mean :25.3 ## 1/2/17 : 1 3rd Qu.:36.00 3rd Qu.:29.0 ## 1/20/17: 1 Max. :42.00 Max. :46.0 ## (Other):73 ## FGM FGA FG_PCT X3PM ## Min.

item.title: Trial
item.description: data <- read.csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/centerandspread/centerandspread.github.io/master/data/RaceData.csv") A list of general descriptives. summary(data) ## Place Name City State Age ## Min. : 1 Beth : 3 Winchester :49 CR: 1 Min. : 5.00 ## 1st Qu.: 46 Hannah : 3 Nortonville:30 CT: 1 1st Qu.:19.00 ## Median : 91 Aaron : 2 Atchison :21 KS:173 Median :28.00 ## Mean : 91 Derek : 2 Lawrence :11 MO: 3 Mean :32.13 ## 3rd Qu.:136 Donna : 2 Shawnee :11 MX: 2 3rd Qu.

item.title: Visualizing
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. RaceData <- read_csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/centerandspread/centerandspread.github.io/master/data/RaceData.csv") head(RaceData) summary(RaceData) You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.

item.title: show
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: library(readr) ## Warning: package 'readr' was built under R version 3.3.2 RaceData <- read_csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/centerandspread/centerandspread.github.io/master/data/RaceData.csv") ## Parsed with column specification: ## cols( ## Place = col_integer(), ## Name = col_character(), ## City = col_character(), ## State = col_character(), ## Age = col_integer(), ## Gender = col_character(), ## Time = col_time(format = ""), ## Pace = col_time(format = "") ## ) ## Warning in rbind(names(probs), probs_f): number of columns of result is not ## a multiple of vector length (arg 1) ## Warning: 164 parsing failures.

item.title: A Plain Markdown Post
item.description: This is a post written in plain Markdown (*.md) instead of R Markdown (*.Rmd). The major differences are: You cannot run any R code in a plain Markdown document, whereas in an R Markdown document, you can embed R code chunks (```{r}); A plain Markdown post is rendered through Blackfriday, and an R Markdown document is compiled by rmarkdown and Pandoc. There are many differences in syntax between Blackfriday’s Markdown and Pandoc’s Markdown.
